item.text: [[EdTech]] - educational software, and hardware

I reflect on why hardly a day goes by when I am not asked if it wouldn't be possible to hide the Journal. My position has been that it should be more present, more beautiful, more of a guide to knowing. What is it that people expect from a computer?
item.title: Journal as History Visualized

item.text: A scrapbook of notes and links to everything related to technology for education:
This page is a place for me to collect examples and ideas for technology that may be useful in a learning context.
item.title: EdTech

item.text: Below are some links to pages on other peoples sites:
Most wiki farms are open. This is for flexibility, and ease of setup. But with a little work they don't have to be.
item.title: Closed farm

item.title: Wants and Needs

item.text: [[FedWiki]]
We collect and manage lists of lists. Just peeking at one of these lists will expand your browsing neighborhood and make searches look further.
item.title: List of Lists of Sites

item.text: Terminology is important. I don't find some of the language to be as simple as it could. I thnk we also need some good shorthands - some I've come across so far include: [[FedWiki]]
[[Images]]
[[Real Time and Chat]]

# Foundational Readings
 * [http://xmpp.org/extensions/xep-0114.html XEP-0114: Jabber Component Protocol]
 * [http://about.psyc.eu/Comparison Comparison of IRC, XMPP and PSYC]
 * some [https://github.com/AgileVentures/EduChat/wiki/Existing-Chat-Servers-&-Clients Existing Chat Servers & Clients]
 * An essay about [http://www.isode.com/whitepapers interconnecting-xmpp-and-irc.html Interconnecting XMPP and IRC] from a commercial provider.

# Prosody
 * [http://prosody.im/doc/components Prosody Components]
 * [http://prosody.im/doc/transports_and_gateways Prosody Transports and Gateways]

Prosody has a simple documentation about plugging in those components, but you find similiar Infos for ejabberd, too.
## Implementations
 * https://github.com/hanzz/libtransport , a.k.a. spectrum.im, but the site is currently offline
 * https://github.com/OchenZloy/ircgw , found via a weird russian blog article
 * https://github.com/PaulFreund/I2X , consider it the dark web
 * mod_irc for ejabberd
 * biboumi
 * BitlBee

item.title: Reflections

item.text: __Links to pages on other peoples sites:__

Federated Wiki combines a few powerful, well-chosen ideas. It's helpful to know what these are. Most of these ideas exist someplace else, the particular power is the combination of the ideas in a single environment.
item.title: Ideas of Federated Wiki
